oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Strother's Meeting House, 2000 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Strother's Meeting Center located on the southeast section of the Scarritt-Bennett Center campus. This log cabin church was the meeting place for the first Methodist conference in Middle Tennessee. That first conference took place in 1802 when the church was located in Sumner County. In 1931 the building was taken apart, moved and reassembled on the campus of Scarritt College. In 1940 the building was transplanted again to a new location on the Scarritt campus to make room for a new dorm. Over the years Methodist relics of early days have gradually accumulated inside. Today the church is used as a teaching museum, open to all who wish to examine Methodist records and furniture of two centuries ago. The foundation is rock. The exterior walls are made of logs. The roof is gabled with wood shingles. The doors are wood. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Strother's Meeting House (Nashville, Tenn.); Scarritt-Bennett Center
